intro: Oldenlandia sipaneoides var. asperuloides, commonly known as the roughleaf mistflower, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender stems and small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are typically rough to the touch, giving it its common name. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
